channel.title: Comments on: Spirituality: Enthusiasm and Schwarmer
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: zjb
item.dc:creator: zjb
item.description: I'm not sure there's a clear, apriori line separating genuine enthusiasm or emotion (a type of musing which neither Shaftesbury nor Mendelssohn rejected) from Schwarmerei. You know it when you see "it." The "it" is what William James might have called "fruit." In the case of Schwarmerei, I'd suggest identifying its fruit as "intentional" hatred and violence; i.e. hatred and violence directed at some intentional object or subject, namely other people, the world, and/or oneself.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/10/27/spirituality-enthusiasm-and-schwarmer/#comment-3708">ej</a>.
It would not be the Zohar or esoteric study. There are some forms of ruah, enthusiasm, seeking experience, fantasy, kumzitz, ebbings, emotional manipulation, rallys, or merging into the dancing that many thinkers consider as crossing a line. The point is that there is a line to these thinkers. Where the line actually is located is subject to debate.

item.title: By: ej
item.dc:creator: ej
item.description: I’m not too clear when someone is a schwarmer. The Zohar’s worlds and sefirot are a priori without any tie in to experience, and have virtually no predictive power. When do we become schwarmers, in imagining such worlds, in thinking these terms point/refer to real transcendental entities, or must we also believe that we know they are real? Suppose someone accepts some story about heaven for the sake of finding a place for punishment and reward, which in turn is felt necessary for morality, but he doesn’t make any knowledge claims…he hopes, he imagines, he wishes and so on. What exactly is the sin? Why isn’t my imagination, my dreams and the like autonomous? Believing in God is ok, imagining a God who hangs out with angels whose names are….is schwarmerei. Why?
